citation.article-title: Identification of bacterial isolates from biofilters as Paracoccus alkenifer sp. nov. and Paracoccus solventivorans with emended description of Paracoccus solventivorans.

p.s: Description of Paracoccus alkenifer sp. nov.

Paracoccus alkenifer (al.ke'ni.fer. M.L. n. alkenum unsaturated hydrocarbons; L. suffix -fer carrying; M.L. adj. alkenifer referring to the occurrence of unusual monounsaturated fatty acids in whole-cell hydrolysates)
Cells are coccoid or rod-like, 04-04 x 0.9-1.7 μm.
Lactate, pyruvate, butyrate, hydroxybutyrate, asparagine, methanol, ethanol and acetone are utilized.
Carbohydrates and amines are not utilized.
Typical monounsaturated fatty acids are 14:1cis7 and 20:1cis13; 12:1cis5, 16:0 and 19:0cyclo11-12 are absent.
The hydroxy fatty acids 10:0(3-OH) and 14:0(3-OH) are present; 10:0(3-OH) is predominant.
The species is a member of the α-3 subclass of the Proteobacteria.
Isolated from biofilters used in treatment of waste gas from an animal rendering plant.
